traitdesc-thrifty: Crafts cheaper ore-bombs with wax or grass, has a primitive blasting powder recipe, and can make bright, waterproof lanterns
traitdesc-crafty: Able to craft metal parts, a hacking spear, and can make scrap weapons, chutes, and mechanical parts with higher efficiency
traitdesc-greenthumb: Can extract seeds from produce, craft rich soil, and soil boosters which boost soil fertilty
traitdesc-forlornhope: Can create tools to repair/create forlorn hope armor which offers fewer downsides, and can make a sword
traitdesc-blackguard: Can create tools to repair/create blackguard armor which offers additional protection
traitdesc-carpenter: Can craft paper lanterns, wagon wheels, wallpapers, and can create cheaper firewood, boards, and sticks
traitdesc-prospector: Can create a copper pan that has a much higher chance to find better items when panning
traitdesc-smith: Can use tool kits to repair armor and shields
traitdesc-mason: Creates mortar, plaster, refractory, and other bricks at lower costs, can directly make stone bricks from stones, and has access to red/brown clays
charattribute-produceDropRate-0.3: +30% extra produce when harvesting planted crops
charattribute-stickDropRate-0.5: +50% chance to get double sticks from branches
charattribute-charcoalPileDropRate-0.35: +35% chance to get double charcoal from charcoal pit piles
charattribute-temporalGearDropRate-1: +50% increase to rusty gear drop rates
charattribute-rangedWeaponsAcc-1: lower ranged accuracy penalty while moving
charattribute-forageDropRate-0.1: +10% chance for an extra forage drop
charattribute-forageDropRate-0.15: +15% chance for an extra forage drop
charattribute-forageDropRate--0.15: 15% chance to get fewer/no forage drops
charattribute-forageDropRate-0.2: +20% chance for an extra forage drop
charattribute-forageDropRate-0.25: +25% chance for an extra forage drop
charattribute-forageDropRate-0.3: +30% chance for an extra forage drop
charattribute-forageDropRate-0.5: +50% chance for an extra forage drop
charattribute-rustyGearDropRate-1: +50% increase to rusty gear drop rates
charattribute-forageLootDropMul--0.2: 20% chance to get fewer/no forage drops
charattribute-forageDropRate--0.2: 20% chance to get fewer/no forage drops
charattribute-forageDropRate--0.15: 15% chance to get fewer/no forage drops
charattribute-oreDropRate-0.4: +50% added chance to get double ore
charattribute-oreDropRate-0.15: +22.5% added chance to get double ore
charattribute-oreDropRate--0.05: -6.25% subtracted chance to get double ore
charattribute-oreDropRate--0.1: -12.5% subtracted chance to get double ore
charattribute-oreDropRate--0.15: -22.5% subtracted chance to get double ore
charattribute-oreDropRate--0.2: No chance to get double ores
characterdesc-miner:
There are things down there that were never meant to be unearthed again, so carelessly do you disturb its slumber.

Miners are great at extracting hidden ore in veins, quickly burrowing through rock, and prospecting with their unique pan, they also come equipped with the skills to make cheaper ore-bombs and blasting powder and can make mining lanterns. However, a mix between the mines and the rot have taken a toll on their bodies, they have a wimpish figure but use fewer calories.
characterdesc-archer:
The only reminants of a defectors past is the guilt they burden for the rest of their lives.

Archers are ranged soldiers that have perfected the art of archery, they keep distance on their targets with increased movement speed, but they are vulnerable in close quarters due to a lack of sword skills and ineptitude with armor.
characterdesc-forager:
Time has taken everything, now you must find your path in this ruined world.

Foragers have learned to make the most of thier surroundings, they posses an amazing green-thumb and can make the most of wild crops. A natural diet has provided them with bountiful health, however they have little interest in the underground and are sickened by the gory nature of melee combat.
characterdesc-vanguard:
You must find the truth, even if the order has crumbled to time.

Vanguards are the reminants of the long forgotten forlorn hope order, they are much more cunning than a blackguard soldier but lack their fierce aggresion, as such they prefer to hide behind their well engineered armors. The temporal cataclysm has taken it's toll on their physique after it corrupted the very energy they worshiped.
characterdesc-farmer:
The great cataclysm only tilled the soil for new seeds to be sown.

Farmers are at home on the vast expanses of tilled soil and grazing fields they usually find themseves on, they are able to harvest more from their crops and are experienced at butchering, leaving little to waste. They can also create soil boosters. While having tough bodies, they find themselves in a far more hostile world than they would have hoped for.
characterdesc-lumberjack:
Wood can hardly stand the test of time, perhaps you cant either.

Lumberjacks are great with trees, they can easily propagate large orchards of lumber and fruit trees, and due to a life of woodworking they can make the most of that harvested lumber and use it to create unique decorations. However, they have little skill outside their specialties.
characterdesc-blacksmith:
The rythmic beats of a blacksmith's hammer gives life to all wars.

Blacksmiths are artisans of both metal and stone, they can refurbish old sets of armor and can get more charcoal from their pits, they also come equipped with the skills to efficiently weave stone and clay into useful constructs. Though, they are not well suited for an outdoor lifestyle.
game:gamemechanicinfo-moreclasses-text:
More-Classes Info
General info

How to change class
In the event that you want to change your class you must have admin privileges (only matters on servers) You will need to run the command: ( /player playername allowcharselonce ) then after, run ( .charsel ) to get to the selection screen. You should probably re-log after doing so to make sure your perks are updated and applied. You should also re-select your class using this process after updating the mod as some changes may not be applied.

Tips
-Unshown in the class menu, the hunter can also make the prevously uncraftable quiver.
-The blackguard and vanguard can create a broken set of their respective armors with bronze, these can be upgraded with iron to fix the set, also, they can create toolkits that they, or anyone with them, can use to repair these armor sets.
-The clockmakers alternate recipes for mechanical parts and chutes often have double the normal outputs.
-The miner can create a copper pan that either they or others can use to pan for ores, it lets you find even more types of nuggets and it can give you minerals, the drop chances of most ores are also much higher with this pan.
-The farmers increased produce gain applies to crops that you have planted on farmland, it only affects the food drop rates and not seed drop rates.
-The lumberjack and blacksmith have similar but alternate recipes for some things so be sure to use them over the standard ones.
-The blacksmith can repair almost any metal armor with toolkits, the toolkits use more durabilty depending on what type of armor they are repairing; with lamellar using 1, brigandine using 2, chain using 2, scale using 3, and plate using 6, meaning, plate armors cannot be repaired with basic toolkits, also brown and red bricks can be crafted, its just not shown in the handbook, they follow the same shape and idea of the colored shingle item recipes.

Droprates
Many classes have been given an increased or decreased drop chance for items or blocks, the way this affects gameplay highly depends on what the modifer is for, but in general the rate of a drop is taken and multiplied by the drop chance then this value is re-added to the original drop chance giving a final true drop chance, for example, most ores and minerals have a 1.25 drop chance meaning it will always drop one ore with a 25% chance at a second, all ore modifiers on characters are shown as the chance that is subtracted or added to that 25% chance, a value of -0.2 means this chance is removed entierly. Using the formula of D x M + D with D being the original drop chance and M being the modifier value will let you calculate any drop rate based off a modifier. Another important value is seed drop rates from non-grown wild crops, which is set at a 0.7 or a 70% chance. Also forage drop rates affect stick, flint, mushroom, and berry drop rates, and all but the berries have a drop rate of 1 meaning, here, it cant go lower on anything but berry bushes, an increased rate means you have that added chance to get a second drop.

Philosophy
More-Classes strives to be a mod that completely overhauls the class system, each class should have their own distinct playstyle and unique perks, some characters have improved recipes, some have new ones, and now they can also influence block drops. This mod requires a ton of delicate balance to achieve this, so please be sure to give your feedback or bug reports on the forum post or moddb.
